story.text: Jan 3 Fannie Mae FNM.N, the largest U.S. home funding company, said on Wednesday it sold $3.0 billion of three-month benchmark bills due April 4, 2007 at a stop-out rate of 5.135 percent, $1.5 billion of six-month bills due July 3, 2007 at a stop-out rate of 5.063 percent and $1.5 billion of one-year bills due Dec. 28, 2007 at a stop-out rate of 4.893 percent. The three-month bills were priced at 98.702 and have a money market yield of 5.203 percent, the six-month bills were priced at 97.454 and have a money market yield of 5.195 percent and the one-year bills were priced at 95.121 and have a money market yield of 5.144 percent. Settlement is Jan. 3-4.
story.title: new issue - fannie mae sells $ 6 billion bills
